snippet: Shell said problems in Nigeria and North America weakened its second-quarter results, and Exxon was hurt by lower margins and reduced volumes at its refineries.
abstract: Royal Dutch Shell reports second-quarter income of $4.6 billion, down from $5.7 billion in same period one year earlier and far below analyst expectations of $5.8 billion; Exxon Mobil reports second-quarter earnings of $6.9 billion, down 57 percent from same period in 2012; both companies' shares tumble following results.
lead_paragraph: Shell said problems in Nigeria and North America weakened its second-quarter results, and Exxon was hurt by lower margins and reduced volumes at its refineries.

headline.main: Earnings at Shell and Exxon Fall Sharply in 2nd Quarter
headline.print_headline: Earnings at Shell and Exxon Fall Sharply in 2nd Quarter
